item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Is Tor still safe to use? (52 points | 10 comments)
2. Why wordfreq will not be updated (1003 points | 315 comments)
3. Moshi: A speech-text foundation model for real time dialogue (80 points | 13 comments)
4. Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models (37 points | 4 comments)
5. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (135 points | 71 comments)
6. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (101 points | 46 comments)
7. A high-performance, zero-overhead, extensible Python compiler using LLVM (90 points | 17 comments)
8. OpenAI Threatening to Ban Users for Asking Strawberry About Its Reasoning (50 points | 18 comments)
9. Show HN: Selectric – macOS Search for Gmail, Outlook, Drive, Slack (34 points | 33 comments)
10. RabbitMQ 4.0 Released (116 points | 41 comments)
11. Holding a Program in One's Head (2007) (37 points | 22 comments)
12. Meta AI: "The Future of AI Is Open Source and Decentralized" (60 points | 27 comments)
13. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (70 points | 48 comments)
14. Senate Vote Tomorrow Could Give Helping Hand to Patent Trolls (69 points | 8 comments)
15. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (183 points | 75 comments)
16. The Dune Shell (117 points | 36 comments)
17. Backlash over Amazon's return to office comes as workers demand higher wages (19 points | 1 comment)
18. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1370 points | 658 comments)
19. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (34 points | 19 comments)
20. Independent directors of 23andMe resign from board (575 points | 312 comments)
21. GM electric vehicles can now access Tesla Superchargers (53 points | 26 comments)
22. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (374 points | 151 comments)
23. Llama 3.1 Omni Model (13 points | 1 comment)
24. Twitter shut off API access; users volunteering their own data for an open API (75 points | 55 comments)
25. Show HN: I made crowdwave – imagine Twitter/Reddit but every post is a voicemail (3 points | 2 comments)
26. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (49 points | 4 comments)
27. CUNY paid Oracle $600M for its HR software (2013) (232 points | 145 comments)
28. Valkey 8.0.0 Is Out (56 points | 19 comments)
29. Microplastics in the Olfactory Bulb of the Human Brain (5 points | discuss)
30. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (518 points | 185 comments)
